text:
Hi, my name is Emmy, and welcome to the Ray 
Dashboard Walkthrough Series, and in this video,

we're going to take a closer look at the logs 
view. Now, you're probably going to arrive at

the logs view by being routed through any of the 
other previous views. You might be interested

in a particular actor or a node or a worker 
process, and when you click on the log there,

you'll automatically be filtered into the log 
that you're interested in. For this video,

let's start on our main overview page. So I can 
select a node to view the log associated with it,

and let's click on, say, this Python 
worker. Now, this is kind of overwhelming,

but complete. So I can search by keyword, line 
number, or even the start and end time, so I'm

able to search for logs as well as filter through 
them to find the particular thing I'm looking for.

That covers the key features for the "Logs" view 
in Ray Dashboard, if you're interested in the

other views, check out the other videos 
in this series, and thanks for watching!
